feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Import to model didn't succeed because of a data locking violation SAC
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am encountering an issue with data locks in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). The data locking functionality works perfectly in our Development (Entwicklung) environment, but in the Production environment, it does not function as expected.

When I try to apply or work with data locks in Production, I receive the following error:

Import to model didn't succeed because of a data locking violation. Error code: 3005

Surprisingly, there is another model that works just fine with data locks both in Developing and Production environment.

 

Has anyone faced a similar issue or could suggest possible areas to investigate?
Any advice on what might cause data locks to malfunction in Production but not in Development would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: Measure based Range filter not working as expected in SAP Analytics Cloud chart in a story
entry.content:
Hi,

When I try to apply a measure based filter by range on a calculated measure in a story, the filter is not impacting the charts in the story. When I check by creating a table and filtering it with the same filter, it is working. The calculated measure is a sum of 4 other measures. The chart being used is a combination stacked column and line chart.

Please suggest.

entry.title: hierarchy node selection (without subnodes and leafs)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I have an input control widget in my SAC story with hierarchy (geog. structure). I am using the selected members of that widget in the script. I would like to read only selected top nodes. Unfortunately when I use API   InputControl_xxx.getInputControlDataSource().getActiveSelectedMembers(1000); I received list of all subnodes and leafs. Example: selection is on EMEA and it gives me not only EMEA, but list of all countries in EMEA. 

This creates a problem - e.g. if I want to populate selected top node (EMEA) into different hierarchy to select different list of leafs (special org. hierarchy), or just simple display text "EMEA" and not the 50 values of each countries in EMEA. 

I am able to extract the top node as the first value in the selection, but only if a single selection is done in the hierarchy. If multiple selections are done, topnodes are not in the first 2 positions of the selection. 

If I compare it to Analysis for Office, it is working exactly as I want to have (selection is done on the node). SAC works unfortunately differently.

Do you have any suggestion?

Thanks

Jakub

entry.title: Display hierarchical information from the CDS view in the SAC table control.
entry.content:
The CDS view used in the table control using SAP BI Launch Pad Webi report displays the GL Group hierarchy as one of its columns, along with a few other amount columns. 

 

Trying to display the GL Group Hierarchy displayed in SAC report using a table.

 

The CDS view in SAP Hana studio contains the below code and is using I_GLAccountInChartOfAccounts

 

   @Consumption.filter: {  selectionType: #HIERARCHY_NODE,
  multipleSelections: true, mandatory: false,
  hierarchyBinding : [{type : #PARAMETER, value : 'P_GLAccountHierarchyName', variableSequence: 70 } ]
                      } 
  //                        hierarchyBinding : [{type : #USER_INPUT, value : 'P_GLAccountHierarchyName', variableSequence: 70 } ] }
  GLAccount,
  _GLAccountInChartOfAccounts._Text[1: Language = $parameters.P_Language].GLAccountName                                                as GLAccountHierarchyName,

 

What is the process for displaying the GL Group hierarchy with its drill down using the hierarchies details displayed in the GL Group hierarchy in the SAC modeler or SAC report using CDS view.

entry.title: I have a scenario where I need to export data for different versions each month from SAC to ACDOCP
entry.content: I have a scenario where I need to export data for different versions each month. For example, this month I need to export version FC 1+11 from SAC to version 401 in S/4HANA (ACDOCP), next months FC 2+10 from SAC to 402 in S4 and so on. Should I create a new export job every month, or is there a way to automate this process in SAP Analytics Cloud?

entry.title: Sort a Chart by Variance via Script in SAC
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm wondering if there is a way to sort a chart by Variance via scripting in SAP Analytics Cloud.

For example, when using sortByValue() I can only sort by measures, but not by the Variance (like ‚ÄúActual vs Plan‚Äù) that I added directly in the chart.

It‚Äôs confusing because through the quick menu in the chart UI it‚Äôs possible to sort by Variance ‚Äî so I‚Äôm assuming there should be some way to do this via script as well.

Has anyone managed to achieve this or found a workaround?
Any help or ideas would be highly appreciated! üôè

Thanks in advance,
Moritz

entry.title: Display measure name with selected variable/prompt value
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I want to display the measure name with the selected variable/prompt value in SAC story table.

Ex: Story has a measure 'Amt' and a variable/prompt for Year. When user runs report by entering '2023' in the Year variable/prompt. The measure name should be displayed as 'Amt 2023'.

I know there is a work around, by placing a text box on the measure column name and enabling dynamic text. 

But it wont work in my case as number of measure column might increase based on filters applied by user. Because i am using dimensions in the column. So when users filters dimension members the number of measure columns increase.

If you look at the below image, 'Meas' is the measure and  'App' and 'Types' are dimensions in the column of the table. As per the image 'S1' is selected/filtered for 'App' dimension and 'T1' is selected/filtered for 'Types' dimension. Hence table shows only one column 'Col1'. The issue is the number of columns increase when user select/filter more values for 'App' and 'Types' dimensions. 

So to summarize I cant use Dynamic text work around in this case as the number of columns is not static. It changes with the user selection/filters.

The story is based on Datasphere Analytical Model (live).

Please let me know how to achieve this either in SAC or in the Datasphere.

Thank you,

deshmukhk

entry.title: Dynamic Threshold-Based Background Color for SAC Numeric Point
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I'm looking to dynamically display threshold-based background colors for a Numeric Point widget in SAC.

I know that in SAC Tables, we can easily apply background colors to cells based on thresholds. However, for the Numeric Point widget, it seems only the text color can be customized dynamically‚Äîthere‚Äôs no built-in option to change the background color based on values.

Currently, I‚Äôve placed the Numeric Point inside a Panel, and while the Panel‚Äôs background color can be set manually, it‚Äôs static and doesn‚Äôt update dynamically with the Numeric Point‚Äôs value.

Does anyone have a solution to make the Numeric Point‚Äôs background color dynamic? For example, using custom CSS or SAC scripts?

Any insights would be greatly appreciated! Thanks in advance!

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: Copy data from last week of last month to first week of next month in SAC planning
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a requirement where i have two measures in the model. One is Units_Weekly and one is Units_Monthly.

The user is entering planning data on Units_Weekly measure and the requirement is to get the last week of Units_Weekly data should be copied in the first week on next month in Units_Monthly data.

For ex: the last week of Jan month is having units of 15000 and i want to copy this to the first week of Feb Month in Units_monthly measure.

 

MonthWeekUnits_WeeklyUnits_Monthly
Jan20250112000 
Jan20250213000 
Jan20250314000 
Jan20250415000 
Feb2025051700015000
Feb20250618000 
Feb20250719000 
Feb20250820000 
Mar2025092200020000

Is it possible to achieve this?

 

Thanks,

Saif

Kindly help please

entry.title: Preparing for SAP C_CPE? Here‚Äôs How I‚Äôm Studying Each Section Without Feeling Overwhelmed
entry.content:
Whenever I start learning something new, I like to have everything in order.
Before I even open the first tutorial, I plan what I‚Äôll study first, what comes next, and how I‚Äôll track it.

Recently, I started preparing for the SAP C_CPE (SAP Certified Associate - Backend Developer - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model) certification. Since this exam covers a mix of BTP architecture, SAP BAS, CAP, Side by side extensions, Cloud Foundry & Kyma Runtime  it can easily feel like too much at once. So I created a simple structure to move step by step without feeling lost.

I began with the learning about BTP, and doing hands on by following SAP Learning Journeys, creating subaccount and adding entitlements and services (It gave me a very clear understanding of BTP architecture) and then Developing appliaction using high productivity tools of SAP BAS, Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) because it‚Äôs the foundation of most topics in this certification. I‚Äôm spending around two weeks learning about CDS models, service layers and how everything connects in a CAP project. I‚Äôm following the official SAP Learning Journey https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-associate-backend-developer-sap-cloud-programming-model and doing small hands-on exercises along the way.

My next focus is Cloud Foundry. I‚Äôll spend about a week learning how to efficiently develop, run, and manage cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime.

After that, I‚Äôll move to Side by side extention on BTP.  This will cover deploying  extension and integrating the app into SAP Build Work Zone.

The next stage is Developing Appliactions in Kyma Environment. I‚Äôll take about two weeks to explore a comprehensive understanding of Kubernetes and to orchestrate the deployment of the applications in the cloud. 

Finally, I‚Äôll study Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK for about two more weeks. These are slightly advanced topics but very useful for understanding to develop and integrate Java, JavaScript, and TypeScript extension applications for SAP solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

So in short, this will be my roadmap-

Recommended Study Sequence

Here‚Äôs the order I suggest, from foundational to more advanced :

  1. Exploring SAP Business Technology Platform 5hrs (link : https://learning.sap.com/courses/exploring-sap-business-technology-platform)
    • This gives you a broad overview of the entire platform (services, architecture, what BTP is). Good for building your base understanding.
    • So start here.
  2. Develop Full‚ÄëStack Applications Using Productivity Tools in SAP Business Application Studio 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-full-stack-applications-using-productivity-tools-in-sap-business-application-studio)
    • Once you know the platform, you learn the developer tooling (BAS = Business Application Studio) which is key for CAP and full-stack apps. 
    • So this is your next step.
  3. Develop Applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime 4hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-on-sap-btp-cloud-foundry-runtime)
    • The Cloud Foundry runtime is a major runtime environment in BTP. Understanding how to build and deploy there is critical. 
  4. Build Side‚Äëby‚ÄëSide Extensions on SAP BTP 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/build-side-by-side-extensions-on-sap-btp)
    • After tooling and platform basics, you dive into extension scenarios (for example side-by-side extensions of S/4HANA using CAP). This aligns closely with CAP certification topics.
  5. Developing Applications in SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime 8hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-in-sap-btp-kyma-runtime)
    • Kyma Runtime is more advanced (Kubernetes, microservices, event-mesh) and often sits on top of foundational knowledge. 
  6. Develop Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK 11hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-advanced-extensions-with-sap-cloud-sdk)
    • This is relatively specialized/advanced (SAP Cloud SDK, perhaps custom libraries, integrations). Once you‚Äôve mastered the fundamentals above, you go here.

By the end of this plan, I‚Äôll go through a short revision period with mock questions and quick notes from my learning.

This structured approach keeps my study plan clear and prevents me from feeling overwhelmed.
I study for two to four hours a day which feels realistic, and the small milestones make it easier to stay consistent.

If you‚Äôre also preparing for C_CPE, it really helps to make your own sequence instead of jumping randomly between topics. The Learning Journeys are excellent resources, but having a personal roadmap makes a big difference.

 

I‚Äôd love to hear how others are preparing for this certification too.
What topics are you finding most challenging so far and how are you managing the learning.

entry.title: copy data based on the current week of current year to next year in SAC planning
entry.content:
Hello,

I want to write a data action which copy the data into next year based on the current week. Below is an example assuming my current week is 202503:

Retail WeekVersionAmount
202601LY2000
 CY3000
 NY2000
202602LY4000
 CY5000
 NY4000
202603LY6000
 CY7000
 NY7000
202604LY8000
 CY9000
 NY9000
202605LY10000
 CY11000
 NY11000

 

Assuming my current week is 202503, so my requirement is to copy the data from Version LY to NY till 202602 and from Version CY to NY from 202603 onwards.

 

I tried to write below code in SAC data action, but it didn't copy anything in next year, because the range in the scope is not correct. 

Do we have any function which gives me date for next year of current week?

 

MEMBERSET [d/Date] = "2026-01-01" TO PERIOD(TODAY())
DELETE()
DATA()= RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version]="public.LY").
 
Is there anyway to achieve this?
 
Thanks.

entry.title: Visualizaci√≥n de dimensi√≥n en SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Buen d√≠a estimados colegas.

Solicito de su ayuda para conocer c√≥mo visualizar en SAP Analytics Cloud, solamente la clave principal de una dimensi√≥n que posee una asociaci√≥n en la Vista de Datasphere mediante una llave compuesta. 

En la vista, la dimensi√≥n est√° asociada de esta manera:

 

En el modelo anal√≠tico, la llave compuesta se visualiza de esta manera:

 

Cuando creo una tabla en SAC, agregando la dimensi√≥n directamente desde el repositorio, se visualizan ambas claves

 

 

El √∫nico dato que deseo visualizar es la llave principal de la llave compuesta (C√≥digo), que es la que aparece en el recuadro azul.

Si agrego solo el atributo, me queda siempre la columna principal con ambas llaves y se agrega otra columna con el atributo como deseo visualizarlo.

 

Les agradecer√© mucho su apoyo.

Slds

entry.title: SAC Planning : Cross model copy with hierarchies
entry.content:
Hi All,
I am trying to copy data from Model A to Model B using advanced formula steps.
These 2 models are having different hierarchies at different levels.
Model A hierachy

Model B hierarchy

I am writing data copy step like below

MODEL [Model A]
ENDMODEL
DATA([d/Measures]="Sales_Qty",[d/Product]=[Model A].[d/Product]) = 
LINK([Model A] ,[d/Measures]="SalesQty",[d/Version]="public.Actual" )
If i want to include the hierarchy either from Model A or Model B , how to do it ?
If we have 2 models with different level hierachies how data will get copy from one to another.

Cany anyone of you please clarify this.
Thanks in advance

entry.title: When export table to Excel in SAC , what filters will be shown in Appendix page ?
entry.content:
Hello , 

I am quite confused what filters will be shown in Appendix page when export table to Excel in SAC.
I originally thought it will only show page filters , no calculation input control will be shown , but based on my testing , sometimes calculation input control are also included.

Take below example , company code , profit centre are page filter ,   while Posting Period is calculation input control .  and don't under why "ledger" (page filter) and other calculation input control are also not included in appendix . System based on what condition to control which filters are displayed in Appendix page ?  

Many thanks.

Lee

entry.title: Calculation of YTD Last year in the model - SAP ANALYTICS CLOUD
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm trying to calculate last year's YTD in the model, but the standard YTD formula doesn't seem to work because I'm also using the PREVIOUS function in the calculation. As a result, no data appears in the measure. Do you know a formula that can calculate last year's YTD in the model?
